original_title: Excise officers involved in Marine Drive shooting given bail
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The four excise personnel who were arrested over a shooting incident down Marine Drive, Colombo on Monday (7) evening, were released on bail on Tuesday (8) afternoon by the Hultsdorf Magistrate's Court.
The magistrate ordered for each excise officer to be released on two cash bails each, and two personal bails each.
It is now confirmed that the excise officers opened fire at a SUV when a heroin dealer attempted to evade arrest and flee.
The suspect had abandoned the vehicle on the busy street, however, he was not injured in the shooting.
He was later arrested in Wellawatte, while fleeing in another van.
The four excise personnel who were arrested over the shooting included a Excise Inspector, and three Excise Officers.
State Finance Minister Ranjith Siyambalapitiya had instructed the Commissioner General of the Excise Department to investigate the incident and submit a report without delay.
Excise Commissioner General Kapila Kumarasinghe told News 1st that a Senior Commissioner of the Excise Department was appointed to probe the incident.
Sri Lanka Police added that an investigation is underway to determine if the excise raid was an official assignment.
This probe is being led by the SSP in-charge of Colombo South.
